page.title: 10MEDIA. NORTH CREAKE
page.content: Apart from the normal use of radio and television, the main sources of news in N Creake, are the London and local newspapers. These are collected from Kings Lynn, and distributed each morning on regular rounds. No supply is available for casual customers. Two free advertising newspapers, from Norwich and Peterborough are distributed by school children. A free-lance journalist lives in the village, and a news photographer from Burnham Market, covers local events. The Creake's News-sheet is distributed quarterly, free, in North and South Creake; listing forthcoming events, and regular fixtures. It is financed by income from the advertising of local traders.
